FYI: They smash bacon into their beans so if you're vegetarian, be sure to ask them for beans without bacon smashed into them. The staff is usually pretty accommodating.   Great for big groups. They have a mariachi band on Friday and Saturday nights so it can get a bit loud.

I'm not sure where to start, the drinks are decent and the chips and salsa is good but the food is tasteless and borderline nasty. It was my clue to get  up and leave once I saw the menu and each food item has a number by its name, that should have been all I need to get up and leave at that time!   The steak and chicken tacos had grease dripping from them, the rice was tasteless and dry and the chicken was like rubber. Another clue should have been to run away is when I pulled up at 5pm and the place was empty. Please avoid this place by all means!! Go to Taco Bell for much better meal experience.

I have not been there in a long time but thought I would do lunch there today. I was seated promptly. Waited about 5 minutes til the server showed up. Waited a little longer from my drink. Ordered a simple lunch item. Then I waited and waited and waited I had been there about 20 minutes by then. I decided to wait another 10 minutes and did. Still no food. No server ever said they would check on my order or anything else. Four people across from me can in a little before me and where served. They had a large order. I do not know if the food is any good I never got to to try it. I finally left after being there for 45 minutes. Will I come back? I doubt it will I recommend it I doubt it.

It's been a while since we've been here.  The delicious green avocado salsa is gone and the Chillaquilles were more like nachos with the tortilla chips remaining crunchy.  Service was top notch however.
Best green sauce ever! Fajitas used to be better. It's almost like they are pre making them and keeping them warm. Not the crowds that used to frequent this restaurant because of above reason.

Pretty disappointing. Start off with a trio of fresh salsas & chips. Seemed like a great start to a good meal. Service seemed slow. Dinning room not to full of patrons @ lunchtime.  I was suppose to have ordered one of their daily special they had offered. The Enchiladas Suizas but was served the Pechuga Suiza. After getting the attention of or server I referenced to the obvious. She apologized however didn't offer to correct it: so I just opted to get a side of the sauce that was suppose to go over my enchiladas. The mini quesadilla had large pieces of chicken inside two dry flour tortillas and the only cheese on it was " on top" just a sprinkling of melted mozzarella. Served with a very small portion of shredded lettuce & a side of refried beans. You can only choose rice OR beans with your meal. BTW it come on the side in a separate small dish.  Felt my meal was very bland and pricey for what you receive.  My friend loves their fish tacos, they looked good -but I personally wasn't impressed with the entire experience.

Disappointed. 6 of us, started out ok, service went from ok to horrible. Halfway thru the meal we couldn't find wait staff, or management. Then a glass shattered and reception gave us a mop then hunted for help to clean up. Took 5 minutes. They never cleaned the table of shattered glass, nor did management check on us. Mind you the restaurant was maybe 20% full on a Saturday night, so crowds weren't a problem. They added 15% to the bill, and for the first time ever, we wanted it taken off. then again, management was missing. Can't even relate to the food, the experience was so bad.

Came here on a Tuesday afternoon and we are leaving very happy! The food was great! I had the chicken flautas and my husband had the #10 lunch special. We are stuffed and we enjoyed it all. The small pitcher of Cadillac margaritas was fantastic and seemed to go on forever. And honestly, it's not the most modern or updated place but who cares as long as it's clean and the food is good!!!

WOW! Can't wait to go back! Their menu is HUGE! I told my husband we will have to visit this place often so I can try everything! Good prices, great service (we had 2 waiters), the food came so fast we had barely sampled our drinks, and it was excellent tasting food! Rustic, casual ambiance. It was a bit loud, but that's how it is when a bunch of people know where to get great food!

I love La Parilla Suiza. It's a Mexican City type thrown down!!!  I haven't been to their other locations in Phoenix only this one but I continue to be blown away by their level of hospitality and the taste and diversity of their food. This was a favorite lunch spot of mine when I live in Phoenix and I make it a point to visit each time I swing by town.   Some of my favorites:  Queso Suizo---plainly put...Melted gooey cheese with torillas. A great start! It does take some time to make so be patient...It's sooooo worth it!  Chicken Enchiladas Suiza with their green sauce-YUM. I have attempted to order this at other joints only to be sorely disappointed that it it didn't have the tangy-ness of this plate. It's seriously heavenly good!  Bistek Tacos-The meat is flavorful and perfectly cooked. Its the type of beef that's marinated and cooked to perfection that you don't need any sauces or condiments to hide the taste. It's melt in your mouth bomb diggity.  Simplicity on a plate.   Chips and a variety of salsas are always on the table...sip on a margarita and you're in the good.   And order the flan....WOW!  I'm sure anything else your order there is good and I would put my stamp of approval on it any day. But, sometimes I can be a creature of habit and order my go-to dishes.  The service is always top notch. They have always been hospitable and efficient, even if your running off a lunch hour.   Go! Go! Go!
Went to lunch with my husband on a Monday afternoon. Ordered the chicken enchiladas con mole. Very delicious! The waitress was excellent. Their salsas are wonderful too.  Will definitely be back!

If you grew up on the west side of town and your family had any knowledge of decent Mexican food, you definitely know La Parrilla Suiza on 35th Avenue and Peoria. Luckily for a childhood friend and I, we were able to find one on this side of town.   Let me preface this with saying the atmosphere is much more open than the original La Parrilla - you will never sit by the kitchen and sweat like can happen in Phoenix.   Then the food. I have always loved their food - mostly the parrilladas - the large skillets with meat, cheeses, and vegetables, but I wasn't too hungry that day since we had already eaten the queso fundido with mushrooms, and a staple you can never miss: the chips with the tray of salsas to choose from.   I ordered a small chicken quesadilla ... that is not what it was really called, but I can't recall the name. As usual, the food was great. The cheese was amazing, the tortillas even better, and the charro beans amazing.   Trying to get out of the Mexican food funk? Try La Parrilla and I guarantee you and your family will be going there 16 years later like I am.

3.5 stars.  After we went to the movies it was dinner time so we went across the street to La Parilla Suiza.  We were greeted and seated and then about 10 mins went by before our server came to take a drink order.  Chips and salsa had been placed on the table but no water or drink orders taken.  Our server did not seem all that enthusiastic.  She seemed as though she was just going through the motions.  I told her it was our fist time there so she pointed out some house specialties and then went to get out drinks.  I saw they had chilequiles on the menu and I love them and not many places serve them.  When I placed my order our server seemed a bit suprised I didn't order one of the higher priced specialties.  Our food arrived and it was hot and the chilequiles were good.  We were never offered more chips and only checked on once during the meal.  The food was fine but the service was lacking, in my opinion.  If I was in the area again I would go back and give them another chance.  Everyone is entitled to a bad day.

Who doesn't like live mariachi music?!  La Parrilla Suiza has a live strolling mariachi band on the weekends, so that gives this place another star in my book.  You'll also feel like you're actually dining in Mexico thanks to the decor and the overall atmosphere of the restaurant.  The food is really good too- my favorites so far have been the cheese enchilada's, chimichanga and fajitas.  Oh and if you're a dipper, chips come with three different salsas!!
Have been back a couple of times.  Service is still on the slow(er) side, but damn, the food is good, and the beers are cold.

Our party of five arrived mid-afternoon for a late lunch.  We were seated at a booth that included old crushed chips underneath the table and chunks of meat scattered on the floor.  Once our food arrived (yes, we stayed to eat...) we had to ask for utensils.  The food was bland overall, although the enchiladas were covered in a greasy pasta sauce (possibly Ragu).  Mexitalian anyone?  Upon leaving we visited the restroom, which appeared untouched by a cleaning agent for an unreasonable amount of time.  Considering we were one of only a few people in the restaurant at the time, the bathrooms should have been clean and our table certainly should have been set.

I see some reviewers have given this place low scores because they are not selling Sonoran food. Hey, you people, it says in big letters on the building MEXICO CITY CUISINE.It is not a Sonoran Restaurant. Its like people ordering spicy Thia food or hot wings and then complaining about the spice. Thanks to these sorts of people restaurants end up dumbing down their food to appeal to the lowest common denominator. Stop it. Go to Taco Bell if that's what you want.  Anyway, this is the third location of La Parrilla Suiza I have visited, the first was Tucson and the second was the 35th Ave. location. Nice looking place. The food was more or less as I remember it, though the chorizo might have been a little less tasty. Their chips and salsas are awesome so be careful not to fill up on those before your food comes. Prices are in line with most other casual dining places. They also have a really nice bar inside. Service was also very good.   If you want a change from the typical Sonoran give this place a try.

Good Mexico City food but sometimes the service is suspect.  Nice to find a menu that isn't just the played out typical standards the margies can be fantastic.  So if you want your atypical fare this is the place but make sure your schedule is freed up for an hour or so.

It has not started well. My booth back is broken so I have lean foreward. The wall along side us had large sections of paint pesled off, its dirty, and seems to be falling apart. To start of with My drink came out wrong and was sent back. My wife got a strawberry  margarita and it is watered down, low alcohol, no salt on glass. Basically the margaritas are trash. It is not happy hour so there is NO excuse for bad drinks. I ordered the Chimichanga my wife the shredded beef burrito. Hopefully the food is better than the impression so far of eating in a dump. Just realized we did not get silverware. I got it from another table seemed to piss off the server.   Got food finally. My wifes burrito the tortilla was so old and stale it's cracked all over, the beef is dried out, and is extremely low quality. My chimichanga for a fried item is completely soft. Might be baked. Low quality food. Seems old pre made. Nothing has that fresh made taste. I have eaten food all over the USA, parts of Mexico, and overseas when I say this is just bad food. You get a decent amount of the bad food. But bad is bad.  One last thing I feel I must add on to this. If you are Hispanic you will get treated much better. Having watched the 3 white people  tables get there food, drinks, and everything else slammed down. We also all got mass attitudes from our waitresses when they bothered to come by. Speak a bit of Spanish and you get 2 or 3 waitresses helping your table. Suddenly  they are nice and helpful. Yes very different service. Also if you check out my pic I added if the waitresses have the time to play games on their phones and screw off they can defiantly provide better service or even clean this filthy place.
Best authentic Mexico City style Mexican food restaurant! Best chips and salsa! My favorite restaurant ever!

If you're expecting the same exact Sonoran style food at every other Mexican place, LPS isn't for you.  If you're looking for the best Mexico City style food, you're home. I always thought it was excellent,  but took a coworker from Mexico City and she agreed!

I'll give it three stars for the food only. Service was awful!!! Also, I believe the AC was not working because it's hotter than hell in there. Our sever walked by our table (once) asking if everything was ok, and my reply in one sentence was "yes can we get some napkins?" And he just kept walking. I'm pretty sure I could of said no and he still would have not stopped which tells me he didn't really care. He took our water glasses and brought them back with no straws. He brought us food but gave us no utensils. Our whole meal we needed napkins, straws, and I had to flag him down for a drink. My tacos were amazing and the salsa was great. That would be why I come back, thanks to the chefs!! Can I tip them instead?
Terrible service.... over priced and not authentic mexican... everything tasted frozen or out of a can.... by far the worst I have expirienced from any chain in az.
The best chilaquiles I have had!  I even needed a to go order so I could eat more later.  I am still thinking about them....I will be back for them!  Save me some!

I am a huge fan of the La Parrilla Suiza restaurants in Tucson.  This branch located in Phoenix is similar but misses the mark compared to its sisters down south.  I have come here a couple of times and both times, service was fine.  The food however seemed to lack the freshness that I was accustomed to from the Speedway and Oracle locations in Tucson.  I REALLY like those restaurants and are some of my all-time favorites.  Part of the issue aside from freshness (of the salsas for instance) was the booths.   They are very compact it seems.  I am not a big guy at all but I felt crampt in the booths.  The back of the restaurant isn't as lively or bright as the other restaurants.  Although you can see the cooks in the kitchen, they are enclosed in a wall of glass or plastic that makes it feel like you're in a zoo.  Overall, not bad...certainly not terrible, just not the "authentic" La Parrilla that I am used to.
Food was bland and pricey... service slow... started with chips and salsa trio so it was off to a good start, but the food was just not impressive. Service was subpar.

Read this for free entertaiment at my expense!  I ordered a taco dish that offers the choice of chicken or beef. My waiter did not ask wh2at I wanted and brought me beef when I wanted chicken. I did not think to specify, and feel that the waiter should have asked, not just bring me whatever!! The beef was a bunch of very tiny cuts that were burnt and super tough! I had to spit out bite after bite because I couldn't chew it, even will a full set of healthy chompers!  I ordered an extra side of rice. It didn't come with my meal. I asked for it and was told it would be right out. When it didn't arrive, I asked a second time. It didn't arrive...EVER!!!!  We were there for almost two hours as the service was SLOW!!!! When the bill came, we didn't even complain or ask that the price of the rice be removed from the bill BECAUSE:  AT THIS LOCATION, THE MANAGER IS A *BLEEP*!!! She will lose her temper and act like a crazy nut and tell you to never come back if you complain!! She is scary!! You will question whether she has surveillance watching you as you leave in order to get your license plate so she can send a mobster to your house to rough you up!! NEVER in my life have I been afraid of a restaurant manager! Holy crap Batman!!!   One little question will set her off. I ordered takeout for the first time. When I got home, there was no hot sauce with my order. I called to ask, for future reference, if they usually include hot sauce, and she yelled at me, "Unless you spend $10.00, you don't get hot sauce!" I responded that it would be nice if they told me and gave me the opportunity to pay for some. I told her my food tasted like Taco Bell, and she screamed, "Our food is nothing like Taco Bell!!!!" I responded that mine tasted like Taco Bell because I had to use Taco Bell sauce on it. She cussed me out and told me to "Never come back!!!!"  There are more instances with this crazy lady, but I know if a review is too long, people won't read it.  I encourage the owner to contact me for more details!!! The manager needs to be on medication or get rid of her!!

This place earns it's stripes.  The food is fantastic. The service is wonderful. The staff actually remembers you if you come in a second time.  And if you like cheese, well, this is kind of a cheese nirvana.  The food is not boxed and quartered into the familiar bland Mexi of other Arizona digs and actually offers dishes that are interesting.

When I lived in Arizona ( from age 5 to 30), I ate at La Parilla Suiza a lot, at several of their locations. This is the one closest to my childhood home, and I think it was the prettiest of the restaurants. My mamma and I used to eat lunch there. My dad and his third wife liked it too ( but not with my mom, of course).... anyway, ahem.  I love their melty cheese and mushroom appetizer, their chips and salsas, their tamales and enchiladas.. and the fajitas.   In college a Latino friend of mine took me to eat fajitas at the one in Tucson near the U of A campus, and I was busy forking chicken and peppers into my tortilla ( daintily, like a lady) when he took my fork away, put a tortilla in my hand, and said "no, LIKE THIS!" and demonstrated how to grab the stuff in the tortilla.   I have to admit, it was faster and more fun.   The fajitas are typically really really good, across the board.   I miss LPS and as much as I try to emulate their fajitas in my home, it's not the same. they do a great job. If you get to Phoenix or Tucson, give it a try. MMM.   Oh, and the tortilla soup, to die for. Really.  P.S. They catered my dad's wedding to his wife, and the food was fabulous.
First time here, good food wonderful service. Manager came over and introduced himself very impressive. Loved our first visit defiantly will come back.

Some of the best Mexican food you can get!   My family and I come here regularly and it is always great!   They have the best tortilla soup, homemade tortillas, and awesome alambre tacos.  Service was a little slow,  but they made up for it by giving us free dessert, fried ice cream,  YUM!

Not impressed!! Service was horrible, 10 minutes before anyone even took our drink order. Another 10 minutes to get or drinks. 25 minutes for our food to come out. The beef on our quesadilla was excellent the charo beans were as well. However everything else lacked flavor and was cold.

This place was ok. It was recommended to us from a friend who knows authentic mexican cuisine. When you first arrive they bring you out chips and 3 different types of salsa (green, spicy red, and pico de gallo). They are all pretty good. I ordered the cheese enchiladas and asada taco combo and it was ok. I really liked the enchilada sauce, it's definitely not your canned version in most restaurants around here. The tacos weren't the best. The beef seemed kind of dry. Although the tortillas were homemade. Warning: This place only gives you one free drink refill before they charge you for another drink and it's like 2.25 or something....weird. They also only give you one chip refill before they charge you 1.99 and they don't give a lot of chips.

I've been to this place a couple of times while living in Arizona. When I first came I was impressed. The salsas are all amazing, especially the green one! The portions are HUGE! Enough to feed a small village. Nice Mexican restaurant decor. They have TVs to watch games. This is good Mexican food in Arizona. I will be coming back here when I visit.

So I have been to the location in Tucson and now experienced this one and I have to say that I did not have a WOW or YUMMM drooling moment at either. Don't get me wrong it's not horrible it just has no wow factor at all to me and I will pass next time.  There is just better Mexican cuisine out there,,,   Service was promt though!
Food was okay but service and prices are great. I would eat here again.
Been 3-4 times, Good food for most part.  Better than garcias  across street.  Only bad thing is last time saw some roaches, pretty gross.

Worst. Customer. Service. EVER.   I was supposed to meet my family here after my son's high school graduation.  By the time I got out of the parking lot it was 9:30, and I called to say I was on my way.  Even though the sign on the door says open until 10:00, the manager informed my party that they were locking the doors in 5 minutes and I would not be allowed to enter.   So thanks La Parilla Suiza for ruining my son's graduation dinner. The quality of the food is irrelevant when you treat customers like crap. This is the second negative customer service interaction I have had with them.  Will not be giving them any more of our business.

I've been to both the North Phoenix and Mesa location and the experience was about the same.  The service was lackluster, and there really wasn't that many customers in the restaurant.  The thing I found to be the worst was that the food I got was COLD!    One of my friends loves this place but I believe it's because of the salsa not the service or the atmosphere.  I recommend anything but this place for lunch or dinner.

I worked here as a hostess for a little over 2 years and never got sick of the food! Talk about real authentic Mexican food! Garcia's, Serrano's, and Macayo's have nothing on this spot. When you first sit down, you get served chips with 3 different salsas (the green is my fave!). The green chili enchilada sauce is amazing and the tortilla soup makes for a great hangover remedy! They also have great combination plates and parrilladas! For dessert, I would definitely recommend the sopapillas with honey! Part of me wishes I could still eat their food every day! I give them 4 stars only because they got rid of the weekend mariachi group.

Food, excellent as always. I've been dining here for nearly 20 years. Service, horrible. Last night was the worst I've ever experienced there. Lots of waiters doing nothing, managers holding up the bar, maybe one busser in the restaurant. Took forever to get a water. Took forever to be followed up with. Oh, and when you order an appetizer isn't it supposed to come before the main course? 2 stars for this visit, and that's only due to the cooks doing their job right.

Today was the last time I'll ever go to La Parilla Suiza.   #1, and most importantly, they don't offer the green sauce anymore with chips. They sold me on that 20 years ago during my first visit and it was one of the only reasons I went out of my way to one of the LPS restaurants. The waitress today said they don't have it anymore, period. Their replacement is a green salsa which is meh.  Went for lunch today because we had a craving for the green sauce and the #5 (cheese for 2). The #5 was great as always, but that alone won't retain our business. The taco on the lunch menu was not really a taco. At least I didn't expect 1 street taco with a cheese enchilada on the menu. It was 1 small corn tortilla with a little meat, nothing else. See pic.   Music was so loud and disruptive, couldn't hold a conversation at the table.  The location in Phoenix closed, not surprising as there was never anyone at either location. Website says stay tuned for new location.  I won't return unless you bring back the green sauce.   Service is never fantastic, see a previous review at Phoenix location.   Based on previous reviews, and what I saw today...nobody goes to this location anymore so it's only a matter of time before the Mesa location closes.  Even if you bring back the green sauce for a small fee, let me know. I'll pay.  Oh and one last thing, I swear their beans are the Rosarita beans in a can at the grocery store. I've always thought that. Go buy a can, sprinkle a little white cheese on top and you'll see.

My wife and I go here quite a bit and I just realized that I haven't written a review. We actually held our wedding reception in there back room. They serve great food from Mexico City. Our preferred server is Enrique!!!! He is awesome and takes great care of us. Everyone is very nice and Jorge the manager is very awesome to work with. The prices are great as well.

Service was the worst!  Hire a busboy, people! The PV location was a regular place for us. Here, the staff was slow the food was slow being served and had obviously sat on the line for awhile. And there was a grand total of six tables in the whole place. Really bad. Very disappointing. I watched our server come out of the kitchen with food, go to the bar with it, do something to it, then go back in the kitchen and bring it to the dining room and serve it. Horrendous! I guess we'll have to get our La Parilla fix in Tucson - if I can even bare to cross the threshold again. We definitely won't be returning to this location.

The food I got at this place is the best Mexican food Ive ever eaten in the valley. I ordered some steak tacos and chicken soup and everything was perfect. High quality Mexican food. Will come back definitely.

I moved very near this restaurant about a year and a half ago.  The first time we tried it, we loved it enough to keep going back several times.  The food was delicious and original -- not what you get at a typical generic americanized mexican restaurant.   The place has really gone down hill a lot in a short time. The latest time we went will also probably be the last time we go.  The food simply stank.  Everything came with a pile of hard purple cabbage, which unlike the typical but useful pile of lettuce&tomatoes, was nothing more than garnish.  (this cabbage can be seen in just about all of the photos others have posted)  Dishes that had been consistently good over several visits were suddenly changed, and not for the better.    My daughter's shrimp tostada thing was a portion size almost half of what it used to be, and if she's going to order something that costs more than what I order, It'd better be worth it, dammit!  I know Parrilla Suiza has long been considered agreat place, and not your typical mexican restaurant, but it just isn't the case anymore.    I am curious if any other former long-time customers are recently feeling the same?

Enjoyed our meals immensely!  Every item was flavorful. Chicken enchilada , chicken flautas, chicken fajita all  excellent. Dessert was amazing!  Flan and churros were so good. We would recommend La Parilla Suiza  to anyone looking for a good Mexican meal.   Only thing is our guests would have appreciated a mild sauce.

What a waste of time/money. The menu pictures of the food look delicious, but what I got was completely different!!!!!   I wanted it to be tasty....but I got some slapped together shrimp tacos with...white rice? White rice and butter. Crunchy..BLEH.  I was expecting lots of shrimp for the expensive plate I bought. I got tiny little shrimpies....DON'T DEPRIVE ME OF MY SHRIMP! I love shrimp. Anyway, so bland....no flavor....so LITTLE food....I am not one to eat a lot, I just was expecting a bigger portion for what I paid for  I feel like a jerk every time I rate a place low. But The thing is, when I dislike something, the first thing that comes to my head is: I gotta tell other yelp about my terrible experience!!!
Definitely one of the better Mexican restaurants. Great service and the food is well cooked and presented. Nice atmosphere and friendly service.

It is an upscale Ameri-Mexican chain that is well runed by attendative staffs as well as favorites of Mexico.  It is slightly higher than a typical Mexican restaurant so I would describe it as BF Chang of Mesa.  Good choice for novice Mexican foodie.   No tongue or tripe or fat cheek meat that I love.  Decent experience.

Been going to this establishment for years; since 1987.  Albeit mostly the original location in NW Phoenix, but I have been to this Mesa location 4 times.  This restaurant is going downhill.  Food is getting worse and the portions smaller.  Further, customer service sucks!  Although the prices are reasonable, the food is mediocre at best.  You are better off eating at the food courts of the Mexican oriented grocery markets - at least the foods there are more authentic and tasty.

Long overdue review as this has been a favorite here, and in Tucson, for many years. For edification, "authentic" Mexican cuisine can be a  nebulous and misleading generalization. There are many different regional varieties from northern, central and southern Mexico. Most of the Mexican restaurants in AZ are of the northern ilk. La Parrila Suiza is Mexico City cuisine and excellent at that. Nice place to bring the family or dine at the ample bar if solo. Several different combos to choose from; favorite is Parillada Mixta No. 39. Mixed grill of charbroiled beef strips two quesadillas and a bell pepper stuffed with cheese accompanied by chorizo and grilled green onions, all served on an individual little grill with mesquite charcoal underneath. Served with terrific soft corn tortillas; make your own tacos with a spoonful of cheese, chorizo and beef strips--killer!!  I eat the whole thing, but two could easily share this. Don't miss it!

After driving home from. Las Vegas we wanted to grab some Mexican food and sit down and have a Margarita. We checked out a few places on Yelp near our home that we had not tried yet,  and we're still open. This popped up and they were open until 10pm so we stopped in.   It was a Monday night 90 mins before closing so we weren't sure what to expect but there were a few others eating later as well. The restaurant is sit down and full service with many booths and authentic recorded music playing at a very nice level for conversing.   This is the cuisine of Mexico City and not your typical americanized version. The chips come with three salas and all were great. Chips thin and crispy just like I like them. We ordered a small pitcher of the house Margarita and we each got 2+ glasses out of it. Not too sweet or tangy...  just right.   I had the Carne Asada with cheese enchilada, rice and refried beans. Steak cooked medium was tender and juicy and not too much salt. The rice and beans nice and the cheese enchilada was not greasy and tasted very fresh and nice.   My wife had the Enchiladas Suizas and chose to have one of each (beef, chicken and cheese) and all were very tasty and fresh as well. This plate came with Ranchero beans and she loved those too.   Our server was very attentive but not overly so. She let us sit and enjoy.   We will definitely be back and try more items on the menu. This was a great first visit.

We came here from looking for a Sam's Club to spend our rewards money we got since ours was already closed down in Alaska.  It is far from where we are staying in Scottsdale and since it is Cinco de Mayo we thought of Mexican food.  Food in pictures  in yelp are not what I saw put on the table from other guest sitting in restaurant.  It is a typical mexican restaurant with OK food.  The salsa and chips were good but was really spicy.  I kind of lost my appetite after visiting the restroom before eating to wash my hands, the restroom was dirty and stinky even my 9yr old daughter didnt even want to use it.  I always have this thought that if they cant keep a restroom clean how much more their kitchen.  I think the place needs to be updated and deep cleaned.

Had the steak fajita quesadilla, which was good, no doubt about it. However the service was awful. We got chips and salsa but the girl who served us brought a bowl of broken chips..I mean - seriously broken up, can't dip into salsa - broken chips. When we asked for new ones, she brought a new bowl and just put some unbroken ones on top and left the bottom portion full of broken chips. She also didn't want to bring us any more salsa without charging for a pint of it. Barely got extra water..she was quite surly by the end. Ladies bathrooms were quite unclean. I won't be going back.. I have had the same rude experience at another location at the PV Mall area. Frankly, the decent food doesn't make up for the lousy and surly service.
2nd time my wife and I have eaten at La Parrilla Suiza.  There will NOT be a third time.  Food was below par and service was terrible.

I've been coming going to the Mesa location for years and this is my first time to this location but again everything was good. I usually get a Parillada Suiza and tortilla soup. Best tortilla soup ever. Service was also great

What you need to know is that this is NOT a standard Mexican joint.  You may find some names similar to what you can get at Macayos or Garcia's or heck, even the wonderful Carolina's.  This isn't Sonora cooking the way we know it, and it's not Tex-Mex either.  This is Mexico City food.  Go as often as you want - no passport required.  Let's start with the feel of the place.  It's on the corner of a strip mall, but it's behind a bank building so you can't see it from the street.  Once you go inside, you might forget you're in a strip mall across from a suburban mall (Paradise Valley Mall).  There are custom brick and stone archways dividing the entrance and midway through the restaurant.  Great copper work along the wall that has a window into the kitchen, highlighting the copper plates above the window ledge.  There is a mural on the wall over the ample sized bar area that is an homage to Diego Rivera's work.  In shelves, and over the archways there are other pieces of pottery, tile work and other pieces that really set the stage.  They also have a great outdoor seating area off of the bar with overgrown climbing plants providing shade in the summer and heaters for colder nights.  There are several scattered TVs that are both viewable from most tables but are easily ignored.  Most nights it is soccer - of course.  You'll be brought chips and 3 dippers, a green tomatillo sauce, a great chunky salsa and a red sauce that has a nice spice to it, but I can't quite place the flavor.  Next, you'll notice the menu.  The last time we went my dining companion notices how many items were made with bacon.  You'll also find lots of great meals that I haven't seen served at other restaurants.  In my years of coming here, I haven't been disappointed by a dish yet.  Some items are similar, but different. Enchiladas are almost square shaped and come in a small dish.  Fajitas don't come in a skillet, which continues to cook and burn the edges, but in a large heating pan that you'd imagine seeing on a buffet line.    Average meal price is about $12 and worth every penny.  Deserts are also wonderful - but it's been quite awhile since I was able to make it to dessert.    La Parilla is really great if you're in the area - and even good if you had to drive a bit to get there.

I've been here three times so far and the last time I came here, which was last night, it was terrible. The previous visits were okay but last night's dish sucked ballz. I got the carne asada burrito which consisted of dry carne asada meat inside of a flour tortilla. No sauce, no cheese, no nothing. It was so dry! I mean really? Put some kind of thought into it. And it was  $11.50 for that. The pinto beans that they had in a cup on the side had a strange taste to them, too. The waitress was a ding bat and had no other suggestions for us when all they had were regular highchairs from 1930 that don't accommodate modern infant carriers, which we ended up having to set on the ground. How about offering to get us a chair to set it on? Idiot. Yea, I won't be back here any time soon.

Not very impressed. The food was ok, but I have had better at other local eateries. I guess my expectations were set so high that I was expecting the WOW factor, and it definitely did not deliver.  Probably won't return, just because there are so many other good choices.
This place is overrated,  the food is NOT authentic at all.  California is where the real Mexican food is.
